result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Antonio Ramirez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luis Antonio Ramirez not in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning appeared by video for Luis Antonio Ramirez.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.

Defendant Luis Antonio Ramirez in court with attorney Haley Wentz on behalf of attorney Sam Obscherning.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luis Antonio Ramirez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. State has sent over discovery and an offer. Defense needs time to review.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Happy 8 Collectibles.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/28/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Luis Antonio Ramirez in court.  Katie Bakunowicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Luis Antonio Ramirez not in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @2p
